column4: can you launch a terminal window? are you familar with the terminal?
ok, launch terminal and type df -h   to list mounted drives and see if you can spot your main drive mounted, looking at size column might help you identify it
nice!
try to df -h again and see if you can see it listed
ok the last column shown by df -h is where it is mounted, can you CD to that directory?
Im probably not gonna be able to get your graphics card set up correctly, but hopefully can at least get it to boot again
ok, can you see a directory in there called etc?
cd into etc/X11
then do ls -l to list files, Im hoping alongside an xorg.conf that a backup had been made like xorg.conf.somethingelsehere
thats a letter l not a number 1 (sorry not sure what level you are at so being careful)
awesome, does the date on it look like around the time you tried to get the drivers working?
ok lets first make a backup of your non-working xorg.conf file (btw thats the xserver graphics configuration file), to do this type: sudo cp xorg.conf xorg.conf.notworking
you will need to enter your password for this
type pwd and tell me what it says your current folder is please
ah thats why, at this point we want to be in your mounted drive folder, and then cd to etc/X11
are you looking at X11 as a folder on the desktop or in the terminal?

we need to do this in the terminal as we need root access to backup / restore the xorg.conf file so, when you type df -h in the terminal can you look at the last column to see where your main drive is mounted?
ok great, so on the command line type cd /media/disk/etc/X11
ok, now is you type ls -l    can you see both xorg.conf and xorg.conf.bak?
great. now type sudo cp xorg.conf xorg.conf.notworking
that means you have a copy of where you got to, even though it was broken, just in case you want to refer to it, next we will restore from your backup by typing: sudo cp xorg.conf.bak xorg.conf
ok, now you need to try rebooting without the cd, I hope that works for you, I've got to go now, if that doesnt work then you probably want to ask "how do I reconfigure X", good luck mate
good luck, and may the force be with you
